sub_topic: Using the unit circle to find trigonometric values
message_1: What are the sine, cosine, and tangent values of the angle 30 degrees using the unit circle?
message_2:
In the unit circle, the sine, cosine, and tangent values for an angle can be found using the coordinates of the point where the terminal side of the angle intersects the circle. For a 30-degree angle, the values are as follows:

Sine (sin) of 30 degrees: sin(30) = 1/2
Cosine (cos) of 30 degrees: cos(30) = √3/2
Tangent (tan) of 30 degrees: tan(30) = sin(30)/cos(30) = (1/2) / (√3/2) = 1/√3 = √3/3
